data.text:
"I am deeply honoured and grateful for the trust you have placed in me to serve as the Secretary-General of the United Nations for a second term."

See how the UN family congratulated @antonioguterres on his re-appointment in this @TwitterMoments: https://t.co/MuiCQKYDJs

No more impunity. No more silence. No more stigma.

Saturday is the International Day for Elimination of Sexual Violence in Conflict, an abhorrent crime that is often underreported and must end. https://t.co/Bg695zsc8l #endCRSV https://t.co/9iChMwCmro
New outdoor exhibit at UNHQ features images of rural transformations with special focus on food security, ecological change and #ClimateAction. https://t.co/fsuAihsHq4 https://t.co/YfgTA8H9ZU

On Friday's #SustainableGastronomyDay, #PeterRabbitFoodHero reminds everyone that eating local and seasonal fruits and vegetables is good for your health, the local economy and the environment.  

More ways to #ActNow for a healthier future: https://t.co/iKR8DAkaYB https://t.co/MM9S6lKxA8

"Serving the United Nations is an immense privilege and a most noble duty."

-- @antonioguterres following his appointment to serve a second term as UN Secretary-General. https://t.co/vmdEPtLFKj https://t.co/tXaog4IQcy
.@antonioguterres reappointed for second term as UN Secretary-General. https://t.co/OZcDPJf5Cn

The number of people forced to flee due to conflict, war & human rights abuses reached a record-breaking 82.4 million in 2020, warns @Refugees.

World leaders urged to take action to end decade-long trend of surging displacement. #WithRefugees https://t.co/duFgUC6Jy0 https://t.co/yEWuEvJFeC

On Friday's #SustainableGastronomyDay, check out these tips from @FAO’s Goodwill Ambassador chefs on how we can buy, cook & eat food that respects our planet & our health: https://t.co/q0QckkyQM8 https://t.co/rDYkU1wD2m

Youth are creating social change to address critical issues facing the world today, including the climate crisis, gender equality & more. 

Join Friday's high-level event at 9:00am EDT focused on protecting the participation of young people in civic space. https://t.co/13sSLjb5m6 https://t.co/AM4uLAhx7c

🍽 What we eat & how that food is produced affects our health & the environment.

From trying sustainable recipes 👨‍🍳 to cutting your food waste 🗑, find out what you can do to be a food hero on Friday's #SustainableGastronomyDay: 
https://t.co/iKR8DABMnb https://t.co/Ag1myjhjd1

Sustainable gastronomy helps improve:
🥦 food security & nutrition
👩‍🌾 sustainable food production
🌱 conservation of biodiversity

More ahead of Friday's #SustainableGastronomyDay: https://t.co/B6m2PClS8c #GlobalGoals https://t.co/qfyBxrDUmg

Up to 700 million people could be forcibly displaced by 2030 due to drought.

@UNDRR's #GAR2021 report calls for immediate action to reduce drought risks to protect lives & livelihoods: https://t.co/k5McObLdPc https://t.co/qPRjm6Hoor

1 in 100 deaths is the result of suicide.

Every year, more people die as a result of suicide than HIV, malaria or breast cancer. 

New guidance from @WHO aims to help countries improve suicide prevention & care. https://t.co/yOYWPZ2Sgs https://t.co/NbnO3mOrMd

"You cannot just live your life being paralysed by the past."

-- Holocaust survivor & human rights activist Rabbi Arthur Schneier, talks to @MelissaFleming about his contribution to inter-religious faith & understanding on our 'Awake At Night' podcast. https://t.co/l5R4CQsPUn https://t.co/gHwAxDpNqv

Extreme weather events have almost doubled in the last 20 years compared to the previous 20 years. 

Restoring degraded land can help reduce the impacts of drought, floods & storms. More on Thursday’s #DesertificationAndDroughtDay from @UNCCD: https://t.co/fIirAWB4MP https://t.co/1vbFi6tsZn

When it comes to #COVID19, no one is safe until everyone is safe.

Read how @UNMaldives has supported the pandemic response in the Maldives and why vaccine equity is crucial for protecting lives & ensuring countries can recover better. #OnlyTogether https://t.co/B1sBX0b8WJ

#COVID19 has demonstrated the fragility of our world - and the importance of protecting the environment, human health & economies.

On Thursday’s #DesertificationAndDroughtDay, learn how sustainable land-based solutions can increase resilience: https://t.co/hjXticUW9e https://t.co/cVg6xtxEJH

"I am truly and sincerely humbled at my opportunity to serve, and the responsibilities that have been entrusted in me."

-- Karim Asad Ahmad Khan QC sworn in as new prosecutor of the @IntlCrimCourt. https://t.co/4Nmj7WUL5M

Land restoration helps: 
➡️ tackle the climate emergency 🌍
➡️ conserve biodiversity 🐨🐯🐸
➡️ improve food security 🍲

More on Thursday’s #DesertificationAndDroughtDay from @UNCCD: https://t.co/fIirAWjtVh https://t.co/uW67tRQdFb

Greater international cooperation is needed to address conflict, the climate crisis & #COVID19, according to outgoing @UNReliefChief.

🎧 More of what he has to say about the unprecedented rise in people requiring humanitarian assistance around the world: https://t.co/oEglMqHCtq

Through its #BestTourismVillages competition, @UNWTO is looking for villages where tourism helps:
📈 Develop economies 
🌳 Preserve natural & cultural resources 
👩‍🏫 Enhance education & skills development
🚻 Advance gender equality 

https://t.co/tPh0v32Bke https://t.co/NJaxRi1pAo

UN Peacekeepers from Benin have left their families behind & continued their important work during the #COVID19 pandemic to protect others. 

We thank them for their service & sacrifice. https://t.co/lZYeCp9I0z #ServingForPeace https://t.co/sWQD9vkk72

We must continue efforts to support & protect migrants, who play such an important role in keeping essential services & the economy running in many parts of the world.

-- @antonioguterres on Wednesday's #FamilyRemittances Day. https://t.co/5zz9F1oGm8 https://t.co/RyARUzrfEO

💼3,067 businesses
🌆733 cities
🌍31 regions
📈173 investors
🎓624 educational institutions
🏥37 healthcare institutions
4,500+ members are in the #RaceToZero to halve greenhouse gas emissions by 2030. 

Together we can do it, if we #ActNow. https://t.co/nSzQQOnC29 #ClimateAction https://t.co/F9uV8CmSbB

Wednesday's International Day of #FamilyRemittances highlights the financial contribution of 200 million migrant workers around the world to their families & communities back home. https://t.co/YbCt9YOn7D https://t.co/lIP3wYQeDT

"Yemen is a tale of missed and then lost opportunities."

-- @OSE_Yemen Martin Griffiths tells the Security Council people of Yemen want stability based on rights and freedom. https://t.co/RqQbLY5P2y

#COVID19 has created significant barriers for migrant women who rely on in-person cash transfer services to send remittances. 

More from @UN_Women on Wednesday's #FamilyRemittances Day: https://t.co/YxueRvVJez https://t.co/BOzbxw569Y

Global business leaders are addressing the converging crises of climate change, #COVID19 and worsening social & economic inequality at the UN @GlobalCompact #LeadersSummit, and offering a roadmap for a sustainable recovery: https://t.co/injsKmojq9 https://t.co/ACpUEMFbJD

Virtual learning has made education more accessible during #COVID19, but for some people with disabilities, the transition has been challenging. 

This week's UN #COSP will shine a light on the need for inclusive education, including during the pandemic. https://t.co/0mKKD2N3pV https://t.co/oSHtEFTEiS

The #COVID19 pandemic has exacerbated poor working conditions worldwide, particularly for domestic workers. 

@ILO says the crisis has highlighted the urgent need to formalize domestic labour to ensure access to decent work. https://t.co/MX34ehVlz9

Internally displaced persons - or IDPs - are among the world's most vulnerable people.

@Refugees explains some of the challenges facing those forced to flee within their own country & what must be done to protect them. https://t.co/YM5TEddjbk https://t.co/15Rzp2NpfB

Elder abuse can lead to serious distress & harm, including physical injuries & long-term psychological consequences.

More on Tuesday's World Elder Abuse Awareness Day: https://t.co/oPJZZXufvd https://t.co/SQfVCYJn5a

“Mali is at a critical juncture and we cannot allow it to slide into further instability, with drastic consequences for the sub-region and beyond."

-- @UN_MINUSMA head @elghassimw tells Security Council. https://t.co/5G3LFfFET2

Tuesday is World Elder Abuse Awareness Day. 

Elder abuse is preventable. Everyone has a role to play -- by watching for signs, staying connected, getting help from local services & more. https://t.co/oPJZZXufvd https://t.co/myKHmB9ssL

“Our existence & ability to thrive in this world is entirely dependent upon how we reset & rebuild our relationship with the natural world, including the health of our land.” 

-- @UN_PGA tells #UNGA meeting on desertification, land degradation & drought
https://t.co/TZb1aKujYK

#COVID19 lockdown measures have resulted in increased violence, abuse & neglect of older persons.

-- Independent @UNHumanRights expert ahead of Tuesday's Elder Abuse Awareness Day.

https://t.co/DKhD9j6BXV

The UN has strongly condemned an attack on a hospital in Syria. 

“Such appalling attacks on civilians & civilian infrastructure, including healthcare facilities & workers, are unacceptable & must cease,” said @UNEnvoySyria. https://t.co/hkIPv1xTlU

"People should realize that they have more power than they think."

-- @MafaldaDuarte, #ClimateAction mobilizer & head of @CIF_Action, explains that as consumers, voters & investors we all have the power to make good choices for our planet & our future. https://t.co/KoIypsqtDp https://t.co/BkCdYCkM7W

Despite contributing only 1% of greenhouse gases, small islands are on the frontlines of the climate emergency. 
 
From Antigua and Barbuda to Cabo Verde, see how @UNDP is supporting coastal communities to build a more sustainable future. https://t.co/z6l1VvPWQZ

Human rights are for everyone, everywhere - no matter who you are or whom you love. 

🖤🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜

This #PrideMonth, and all year round, join UN @free_equal  in the fight against transphobia, homophobia & biphobia: https://t.co/Ljui9G92Ag #StandUp4HumanRights https://t.co/cNSmS8A66H

Benin provides military & police officers to six @UNPeacekeeping missions around the world.

We thank these brave women & men for #ServingForPeace, including amid the challenging conditions caused by #COVID19. https://t.co/lZYeCp9I0z https://t.co/cocfxtcutJ

People around the world have helped achieve safe blood supplies through voluntary, unpaid blood donations, even amid #COVID19.

We thank them for their contributions on Monday's World Blood Donor Day. https://t.co/ZMXstS3jAT https://t.co/RxFmYGB1er

Girls everywhere deserve the opportunity to follow their dreams & realize their full potential. 

@UN_Women is working to achieve #GenerationEquality by empowering women & girls. https://t.co/9DkJpsxvFB https://t.co/pVRgfSXWCE

🩸 Every few seconds, someone, somewhere, needs safe blood.

Monday's World Blood Donor Day is an opportunity to learn more from @WHO about how donating blood can help save lives. https://t.co/ZMXstSkUZt https://t.co/eKlEhCnYqW

"I don't like the word tolerance. Tolerance means I am superior to you. I don't want to be tolerated. I want mutual respect and understanding."

-- Rabbi Arthur Schneier, a Holocaust survivor & human rights activist, on our Awake At Night' podcast. https://t.co/l5R4CQbevN https://t.co/cH56IMHiJF

"Our top priority must be to tackle the climate crisis, or all our other efforts will be in vain."

-- @antonioguterres asks #G7 for #ClimateAction leadership at #G7UK. https://t.co/7SOqSx7R6t

I urge all nations & communities to protect & fulfill the human rights of all persons with albinism, and provide necessary support & care.

-- @antonioguterres on Sunday's #AlbinismDay. https://t.co/pSErqQNKL3 https://t.co/bdYxLwnF2P

A football club in the west of England is making its mark as a #ClimateAction leader. 

From installing solar panels & a pesticide-free pitch, to going all-vegan, read how the Forest Green Rovers are helping to tackle the climate crisis. https://t.co/7ojK0PZ8E0

Every day, people with albinism continue to defy odds, overcome hurdles & face injustices with resilience. 

More on Sunday's #AlbinsimDay: https://t.co/7MKNJl1zls https://t.co/KNGP1FAAO8

"The world cannot go back to what it was. As we count down to the International Day of Peace, I call on people everywhere to be part of a transformation for peace."

-- @antonioguterres marking the 100 day countdown to #PeaceDay. https://t.co/wdIDY5YLNM https://t.co/Hw1CpN2yTR

Amid #COVID19, people with albinism have suffered even further human rights violations, including being blamed for the pandemic. 

On Sunday's #AlbinismDay & every day, #StandUp4HumanRights of people with albinism. https://t.co/zAJAuVVYnM https://t.co/hVQuflX96N

This summer, a unique group of athletes will join other competitors at the Tokyo Olympics.

Read about the @RefugeesOlympic Team & how these athletes' determination has helped them overcome unthinkable obstacles in pursuit of their dreams. via @Refugees https://t.co/MnYnr1jNvP

"We stand in solidarity with all persons with albinism, who with strength beyond all odds, continue to fight for a life that is free of discrimination & violence."

-- @UNHumanRights chief @mbachelet on #Sunday's #AlbinismDay. https://t.co/fhF45kxYPe https://t.co/7BHffF5ubG

"My biggest dream is to become an international chef."

-- Murielle Durandis is pursuing her dream at Emma' Torch, a unique NYC restaurant helping refugees become culinary masters. 

Watch her story: https://t.co/X7F1wQvjTY https://t.co/8Zhd9rrUoE

Worldwide, 160M children are forced into child labour and the #COVID19 pandemic has left millions more at risk, threatening their well-being & future.

More from @ILO on Saturday's #NoChildLabour Day: https://t.co/fIBoQhvXTV https://t.co/8YGzasuh3u

Peter Rabbit is doing his part to protect our planet & he is asking YOU to become a food hero like him.

From buying local & seasonal fruits & vegetables to wasting less food, all of us can take #ClimateAction: https://t.co/X0Shwfcd3n #PeterRabbitFoodHero https://t.co/rtflSRXEqw

It is every child's right to be healthy, educated, safe & free from child labour.

On Saturday's #NoChildLabour Day, see what @FAO is doing to #EndChildLabour: https://t.co/5EUku4BWKl https://t.co/7Z70K201Ob

#COVID19 vaccines are safe. Check out our latest @tiktok_us to learn how these #VaccinesWork. 

By getting vaccinated, each of us can do our part to help ensure everyone is protected. 

#OnlyTogether can we end the pandemic. https://t.co/lsfaV8EZsU https://t.co/DoULKQxyvW

Global progress to #EndChildLabour has stalled for the first time in two decades. More than half of the victims are between 5 and 11 years old.

More from @UNICEF & @ILO on Saturday's #NoChildLabour Day. https://t.co/KQfqW7isW7 https://t.co/pjz0DqSYLO

🧸 Playing
📚 Learning
🌟 Dreaming

Millions of girls & boys are missing out on these key elements of a healthy childhood because they are trapped in child labour. 

Saturday is #NoChildLabour Day.  https://t.co/fIBoQhvXTV via @ILO https://t.co/mATyvW0exn

"It is in everyone's interest that everybody gets vaccinated sooner rather than later."

-- @antonioguterres calls for a global vaccination plan at #G7UK. https://t.co/KJnREyFPNh https://t.co/IBc9iyC3ce

Globally, investment in science has surged over the last five years, yet 80% of countries still invest less than 1% of GDP in research.

Latest @UNESCO report highlights the importance of funding for science to achieve the #GlobalGoals by 2030. https://t.co/f4Lq7yRXd8 https://t.co/SIvDPR7rcC

#UNGA has elected @AlMissionUN, @Brazil_UN_NY, Gabon, @ghanamissionun and @UAEMissionToUN as non-permanent members of the Security Council for 2-year terms. https://t.co/svznen848E https://t.co/wMAQRVVby2

"The worst can still be avoided if we act to help Tigray now." 

-- @UNReliefChief on the worsening humanitarian situation in the Tigray region. 

The UN is calling for more funding & unobstructed access to help those in need. https://t.co/0lLn0l21Jz https://t.co/Tl9ARoMpo4

"Today, the world is focused on stopping the coronavirus pandemic. But we have yet to end the AIDS pandemic.  We must not give up that fight." 

-- @eltonofficial during this week's high-level meeting on AIDS. https://t.co/bQFEyBjT5M #HLM2021AIDS https://t.co/wPBT4EXayQ

📷: #FBF to the UNHQ building in 1964. 

Our Headquarters is in NYC, but the work of the UN touches the lives of people all over the 🌏. Here's what we do: https://t.co/MGT7G5uPFL https://t.co/0POFiCzYel

Are you a young journalist looking to cover this year’s #UNGA & more? 

You may be eligible for a @unraf fellowship. This year’s programme will be conducted entirely online. Find out more: https://t.co/pY2qoccVND. https://t.co/IzG9sOi4gM

UN Peacekeepers from Portugal leave their families behind & make great personal sacrifices to protect others. 

We thank them for their service & sacrifice. https://t.co/lZYeCp9I0z #ServingForPeace https://t.co/ivvMZNLDaW

#LoveIsLove!

This #PrideMonth, see how the UN is joining people around the world in their fight against transphobia, homophobia & biphobia, in our latest @Twittermoments: https://t.co/2mGQzuRdru

New guidance from @WHO calls for mental health care that respects human rights, focuses on recovery & is community-based.

Estimates show that countries spend less than 2% of health budgets on mental health support. https://t.co/321jD6N7fI

New research shows that no leading #G7 stock indexes are currently aligned with the #ParisAgreement. 

Companies & governments need to urgently increase their #ClimateAction. 

More from the UN @globalcompact: https://t.co/WGdp7tBXp8 https://t.co/MWWJLCzXpA

Peter Rabbit has joined forces with the UN to help build a more sustainable world.

From eating more vegetables & fruits to reducing food waste, you too can take #ClimateAction like #PeterRabbitFoodHero: https://t.co/X0Shwfcd3n https://t.co/46j8oUI4Z5

As severe hunger persists in Tigray, @WFP is scaling up its response to deliver life-saving food & nutrition support.
 
More on what's being done as 350,000 people are facing famine in the region. 
https://t.co/gX0r9UWCbf https://t.co/7aswwN671W

160M children worldwide are victims of child labour - and the #COVID19 pandemic has left an additional 9 million children at risk.

Latest from @UNICEF & @ILO on why we must #EndChildLabour. https://t.co/WcdS7FMEuB

#COVID19 respects no borders, which is why none of us are safe until all of us are safe.

See how the UN continues to support the world in the fight against the pandemic in our latest @TwitterMoments: https://t.co/Be0vSucLNO

Transitioning to a green economy can unlock new economic opportunities & jobs. 

An investment of US$1 in #ClimateAction, on average, yields US$4 in benefits.

There is no better investment than the investment in a livable planet. https://t.co/ZIrZ0d8vX5 https://t.co/YT4jNhKDLK

📢 Calling all creators! 

Join #MYWorld360 and share your vision for how we can #TurnItAround for a just, green & equitable recovery from #COVID19. 

Submissions due by 5 August. https://t.co/dxw3nWSqrD https://t.co/P8Ocdvw4zy

"The creation of the International Criminal Court must surely be one of humanity’s proudest moments.”

-- Outgoing @IntlCrimCourt Chief Prosecutor Fatou Bensouda says in final briefing to Security Council. https://t.co/5dKIaLkrcW

Myanmar: Urgent action is needed to avert mass deaths from starvation & disease as violence in Kayah State forces up to 100,000 people to flee into forests & neighboring communities, warns @UNHumanRights independent expert. https://t.co/2JUBinwGI8

#COVID19 is still spreading & producing new variants that put all of us at risk. 

@UNICEF is urging G7 countries to donate 20% of their vaccines by August, because no one is safe until everyone is safe. https://t.co/iDQy2gxJo1 #DonateDosesNow https://t.co/cPrIKCXMGO

This year marks the 70th anniversary of the 1951 Refugee Convention, a landmark document signed by countries after World War II.

On Wednesday's #ArchiveDay, we remember the UN's work to protect those forced to flee & help uphold their human rights. https://t.co/FJuJUnBkCL https://t.co/cUw3CyZDcx

"It has been an immense privilege to be at the service of ‘we, the peoples’ and at the helm of the amazing women & men of this Organization."

-- @antonioguterres following Security Council nomination to serve second 5-year term as Secretary-General. https://t.co/IajEXIW13v https://t.co/ckBP6cECnB

UN Peacekeepers from Portugal serve at great personal risk & in harsh conditions to help others. 

We thank them for their service & sacrifice. https://t.co/lZYeCoS6BZ #ServingForPeace https://t.co/MycmfnqccP

#COVID19 vaccines are safe. Yet, a growing number of networks seek to undermine trust in vaccinations. 

Empower yourself & others with the facts about how #VaccinesWork: https://t.co/2oiOsB9HVB https://t.co/PcF7Fiyy0p

The verdict highlights the determination of the international justice system to ensure accountability no matter how long it may take.

-- @mbachelet as UN court upholds life sentence for Bosnian Serb military chief Ratko Mladić for 1990s Balkan wars. 
https://t.co/sm1jaqRyv6

Human rights are for everyone, everywhere - no matter who you are or whom you love. 

Stand up for equal rights & fair treatment for #LGBTIQ+ people everywhere with the #PrideMonth @GIPHY stickers from @UNHumanRights: https://t.co/NOQGYuB1HR #LoveIsLove 

 https://t.co/GwEcJmdceC

"We need to stop blaming, shaming & discriminating against people in need and start creating the enabling environments that provide real help & hope."

-- UN Messenger of Peace @CharlizeAfrica tells #UNGA meeting on ending AIDS. https://t.co/rZ4XGcTr94 #HLM2021AIDS https://t.co/HtNu14XlR2

"Your investments should not be contributing to climate pollution but should be directed towards climate solutions."

-- @antonioguterres tells Insurance Development Forum. https://t.co/6H1lUr3mJ8 #ClimateAction https://t.co/Al6WpBTZjm

The ocean absorbs more than 23% of CO2 emissions and 90% of the excess heat from human activities.

Our lives & livelihoods depend on the ocean. 

More on Tuesday's #WorldOceansDay from @WMO: https://t.co/gXY0dXluek https://t.co/Za8wYuHW9f

#UNGA elects 22 new @UNECOSOC members to start terms in 2022: Afghanistan, Belgium, Belize, Canada, Chile, Côte d'Ivoire, Croatia, Czech Republic, Eswatini, India, Italy, Kazakhstan, Mauritius, Oman, Peru, Tunisia, United Republic of Tanzania & USA. https://t.co/QFKJSrOJRb https://t.co/yCfQI2v2IQ

Vaccine inequity could cost the global economy up to $1.2 trillion a year.

@UNDP is working to ensure fair access to life-saving #COVID19 vaccines that can bring the pandemic to an end & help the world recover better. https://t.co/mmIqRX1Z8e https://t.co/GxKnw21vyc

With 90% of big fish populations depleted & 50% of coral reefs destroyed, we are taking more from the ocean than can be replenished. 

Tuesday's #WorldOceansDay explores the interconnection between the ocean, life on Earth, and livelihoods. https://t.co/pWXqNh4Rgs

Attacks by armed groups threaten Central Africa’s fragile stability, one of the UN's top officials for the region told the Security Council on Monday, stressing the need to protect crucial democratic gains. https://t.co/qiB2oh2uBQ

The ocean produces >50% of the planet’s oxygen, is home to most of earth’s biodiversity & key to our economy.

The #GlobalGoals aim to conserve the ocean, sea & marine resources for a sustainable future. 

More on Tuesday's #WorldOceansDay: https://t.co/TRCjoRAhTV https://t.co/QXs5ErsXlX

The General Assembly is the foundation of our work at the UN & essential to our effectiveness as an Organization. In 2021, the world needs that effectiveness more than ever.

-- @antonioguterres congratulates @abdulla_shahid on election as next @UN_PGA. https://t.co/3sdP0tWcHy https://t.co/uOhpbomAg4

Tuesday is #WorldOceansDay. 

From eating local, sustainably-sourced fish to stopping plastic pollution, we all have a role to play to #SaveOurOcean. 

More from @FAO. ⬇️ https://t.co/wmZGFeZOZE https://t.co/nV6imV4LK3

"The pandemic has had a cataclysmic impact on the world of work. It's only with global cooperation and solidarity that we'll build a better future of work".

-- @ILO chief @GuyRyder as International Labour Conference gets underway. 
https://t.co/52LqXy6ATF
https://t.co/r4CcwnVEmJ

1 billion+ people have gained access to electricity over the last decade, bringing the percentage of the global population with energy access to 90%.

But without scaled-up efforts, 660 million people will still lack access by 2030.
https://t.co/LSnlowtQxV

.@abdulla_shahid of the Maldives has been elected @UN_PGA for the 76th #UNGA session starting in September. 

See his bio & learn more about his election here: https://t.co/grG2ngJqIu https://t.co/cElgLwF3nR

Burkina Faso: @UNHumanRights calls for protection of civilians following horrific attack on Saturday that left at least 132 civilians dead and forced nearly 800 people to flee for safety. 
https://t.co/thnMjPkVsc
